results.title: Six of the best
results.brief_description: This series looks at issues which affect young adults in their daily life. Six teenagers, Brian, Antoni, Carl, Paula, Sally and Theresa deal with such problems as employment, school and relationships. Passing out, Early starters, Pay day, Pairing off, Shooting through, and Knockbacks.

results.title: Six minutes with nature
results.brief_description: The life cycle of a butterfly known as “The Wanderer” showing the egg, caterpillar, eating, chrysalis and final emergence of the butterfly. This film won a special award for the best nature film in the Commonwealth Jubilee Film Competition.

results.title: Six in Paris = Paris vu par ...
results.creator_credit: Claude Chabrol, Jean-Luc Godard, Eric Rohmer, Jean-Daniel Pollet, Jean Rouch, Jean Douchet, Barbet Schroeder and Les Films du Losange
results.brief_description: Frustrated in their efforts to find financial backing, six French film-makers took to the streets of Paris with scripts of their own devising and 16mm cameras in this demonstration of low budget, rapid production filmmaking. Many of the directors, actors and cinematographers in this compilation would go on to become central figures of the French New Wave. 1.”Saint-Germain-des-Pres” (Jean Douchet) An American studying in Paris is dropped by one French boy only to be picked up by another 2.”Gare du Nord” (Jean Rouch) A young couple’s row is observed in real time in one continuous take 3.”Rue-Saint Denis” (Jean-Daniel Pollet) A shy dishawasher brings a prostitute back to his room 4.”Place de l’Etoile (Eric Rohmer) A businessman hits a tramp with his umberella and imagines he has killed him 5.”Montparnasse et Levallois” (Jean-Luc Godard) A girl fears she has mixed up letters to her two lovers 6.”La Muette” (Claude Chabrol) A young boy tired of hearing his parents argue buys earplugs and fails to hear his mother’s cry for help. In French with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Claude Chabrol, Jean-Luc Godard, Eric Rohmer, Jean-Daniel Pollet, Jean Rouch, Jean Douchet, Barbet Schroeder and Les Films du Losange

results.title: Six heavy fish and a ton of sinkers
results.creator_credit: Roland Beckett and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Historical re-enactments recount the story of the location, recovery and restoration of six cannons jettisoned by Captain James Cook when the “Endeavour” struck a reef off the coast of what is now Queensland. Good use of underwater photography.

results.title: Six English towns: a pattern of building. - Volume 2.
results.brief_description: Eminent architectural historian, Alec Clifton Taylor presents three of his personal favourites- a choice based on each town’s character and visual impact, rather than dry historical facts. With his unrivalled knowledge of building materials, and discerning eye, the viewer learns to appreciate the “lively robust and totally self-assured” key-stones of Stamford, the entertaining Gothic houses of Totnes and the “riotously exuberant” timber-framed houses of Ludlow. This program will entertain lovers of architecture and armchair travellers.

results.title: Six English towns: a pattern of building. - Volume 1.
results.brief_description: The eminent architectural historian Alec Clifton Taylor presents three of his personal favourites - a choice based on each town’s character and visual impact rather than dry historical fact. With his unrivalled knowledge of building materials and a discerning eye, the viewer learns to appreciate Chichester’s marvellous use of flint, the “bastard” limestone of Richmond and the fan vaulting of Tewkesbury Abbey. A delightful, informative program for both those with a passion for architecture and those who know little.

results.title: Six degrees of separation [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Fred Schepisi, Arnon Milchan, New Regency Pictures, Maiden Movies and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: John Guare adapted his hit Broadway play for the screen version of “Six degrees of separation”. Having won accolades on Broadway, Stockard Channing reprises her role of Ouisa Kittredge in the film, directed by Fred Schepisi. Ouisa and her husband Flan (Donald Sutherland) are New York art dealers, trading at the high end of the market to Upper West Side clientele. One night they allow a young man into their home who has been wounded in a street attack and who is coincidentally a friend of their Harvard enrolled children. Paul (Will Smith), the son of Sidney Poitier, charms and beguiles the Kittredges regaling them with tales of his life. But Paul is not what he claims to be, sending the Kittredges on a journey of discovery as to who Paul is and what role he plays in their lives. Their story is retold in a series of flashbacks - dinner party vignettes that reflects the Kittredges’ social status and professional/personal ambitions. “Six degrees of separation” questions notions of belonging and of family, of trust and prejudice and is a sharp observation of identity and social mores in upper class Manhattan. Also stars Heather Graham, Ian McKellen, Mary Beth Hurt, Anthony Michael Hall and Bruce Davison.

results.title: Six days seven nights
results.creator_credit: Ivan Reitman, Roger Birnbaum, Wallis Nicita and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: The perfect scenario - a remote island vacation with the man you love. He proposes, you say yes, life is wonderful. Then you are called away to do a one-day shoot in Tahiti and suddenly your life changes. High-powered New York magazine editor Robin Monroe (Anne Heche) finds herself in this very situation when the plane, engaged for the one-day shoot and piloted by the rough and ready Quinn Harris (Harrison Ford), is forced to land in stormy weather on an unknown remote island. Robin and Quinn are left to deal with each other, with survival and an uncertain future, whilst Robin’s boyfriend Frank (David Schwimmer) and Quinn’s girlfriend Angelica (Jacqueline Obradors) share their fears and concern at the hotel bar. Filmed on location on the Hawaiian island of Kauai. Cast also includes Allison Janney, Temuera Morrison.

results.title: Six contes moraux = Six moral tales
results.creator_credit: Eric Rohmer and Les Films du Losange
results.brief_description: Rohmer’s first series of films, in which his protagonists agonise intellectually over moral dilemmas which confront them.
